t: Psalm 35
Prayer for Rescue from Enemies.
A Psalm of David.
Contend,*pn O Lord,*s with those who contend with me; Fight*ln against those who fight against me.
Take*ln hold of buckler and shield And*ln rise up for my help.
Draw*ln also the spear and the battle-axe to meet those who pursue me; Say*ln to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
Let*ln those be ashamed and dishonored who seek my life; Let*ln those be turned back and humiliated who devise evil against me.
Let*ln them be like chaff before the wind, With*ln the angel of the Lord*s driving them*i on.
Let*ln their way be dark and slippery, With*ln the angel of the Lord*s pursuing them.
For*ln without cause they hid their net for me; Without*ln cause they dug a pit for my soul.
Let*ln destruction come upon him unawares, And*ln let the net which he hid catch himself; Into*ln that very destruction let him fall.
And*ln my soul shall rejoice in the Lord;*s It*ln shall exult in His salvation.
All*ln my bones will say, “Lord,*s who is like You, Who*ln delivers the afflicted from him who is too strong for him, And*ln the afflicted and the needy from him who robs him?”
Malicious*ln witnesses rise up; They*ln ask me of things that I do not know.
They*ln repay me evil for good, To*iln the bereavement of my soul.
But*ln as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth; I*ln humbled my soul with fasting, And*ln my prayer kept returning to my bosom.
I*ln went about as though it were my friend or brother; I*ln bowed down mourning, as one who sorrows for a mother.
But*ln at my stumbling they rejoiced and gathered themselves together; The*ln smiters whom I did not know gathered together against me, They*ln slandered me without ceasing.
Like*ln godless jesters at a feast, They*ln gnashed at me with their teeth.
Lord,*ln how long will You look on? Rescue*ln my soul from their ravages, My*ln only life*i from the lions.
I*ln will give You thanks in the great congregation; I*ln will praise You among a mighty throng.
Do*ln not let those who are wrongfully my enemies rejoice over me; Nor*ln let those who hate me without cause wink maliciously.
For*ln they do not speak peace, But*ln they devise deceitful words against those who are quiet in the land.
They*ln opened their mouth wide against me; They*ln said, “Aha, aha, our eyes have seen it!”
You*ln have seen it, O Lord,*s do not keep silent; O*ln Lord, do not be far from me.
Stir*ln up Yourself, and awake to my right And*ln to my cause, my God and my Lord.
Judge*ln me, O Lord*s my God, according to Your righteousness, And*ln do not let them rejoice over me.
Do*ln not let them say in their heart, “Aha, our desire!” Do*ln not let them say, “We have swallowed him up!”
Let*ln those be ashamed and humiliated altogether who rejoice at my distress; Let*ln those be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves over me.
Let*ln them shout for joy and rejoice, who favor my vindication; And*ln let them say continually, “The Lord*s be magnified, Who*ln delights in the prosperity of His servant.”
And*ln my tongue shall declare Your righteousness And*iln Your praise all day long.
